result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
8:56 AM Defendant Gregory Chase Jurgella in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case and states appearances.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant talked to public defender, did not qualify. 
Defendant hasn't been able to find an attorney yet.
Court questions Defendant further.
Court suggests applying for county appointed attorney. Defendant is willing to do this.
Court advises Defendant to get the paperwork  - petition for appt of counsel and financial disclosure statement (affidavit of indigency). Defendant will need to get the third document from the public defender's office. Paperwork to be then dropped off in Br 2. 

Court will not take a plea today.
Matter to be adjourned. 
Bond has been set previously.

Address/phone are verified.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Supervision Status Report from JusticePoint dated 10/21/22

9:19 AM Defendant Gregory Chase Jurgella in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Matter is set for initial appearance at this time.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant is still seeking an attorney.
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.

Cash bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Supervision Status Report. Filed by JusticePoint - J Poetsch.
Initial Appearance set for 09/26/22 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 2

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License and be absolutely sober. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.

1:12 PM Defendant Gregory Chase Jurgella appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 4th. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
